Description: Fragment of North Ionian or Aelolian pottery dish or standed bowl; white slipped inside and out; glaze fired orange, remains of added colour uncertain. On the inside, from the rim in: broken maeander band; broad band; frieze of lotus flower and tongues; three bands, trace of decoration in tondo. Outside: rim glazed, three bands on upper wall, one on lower wall.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1172)
